manify.predictors.kappa_gcn

Kappa GCN implementation

Functions

Classes

class manify.predictors.kappa_gcn.KappaGCN(pm, output_dim, hidden_dims=None, nonlinearity=<built-in method relu of type object>, task='classification')

Bases: Module

Implementation for the Kappa GCN

Parameters:

  • pm (ProductManifold object for the Kappa GCN)

  • out_features (Number of output features)

  • nonlinearity (Function for nonlinear activation.)

fit(X, y, A=None, epochs=2000, lr=0.01, use_tqdm=True, lp_indices=None, tqdm_prefix=None)

Fit the Kappa GCN model.

Parameters:

  • X (torch.Tensor) – Feature matrix.

  • y (torch.Tensor) – Labels for training nodes.

  • adj (torch.Tensor) – Adjacency or distance matrix.

  • train_idx (torch.Tensor) – Indices of nodes for training.

  • epochs (int) – Number of training epochs (default=200).

  • lr (float) – Learning rate (default=1e-2).

  • use_tqdm (bool) – Whether to use tqdm for progress bar.

  • lp_indices (Optional[List[Tuple[int]]]) – Indices for link prediction task (e.g.: [(0, 1), (2, 3), …]).

  • tqdm_prefix (Optional[str]) – Prefix for tqdm progress bar.

Return type:

None

forward(X, A_hat=None, aggregate_logits=True, softmax=False)

Forward pass for the Kappa GCN.

Parameters:

  • X (Float[Tensor, 'n_nodes dim']) – Embedding matrix

  • A_hat (Optional[Float[Tensor, 'n_nodes n_nodes']]) – Normalized adjacency matrix

  • aggregate_logits (bool) – boolean for whether to aggregate logits

  • softmax (bool) – boolean for whether to use softmax function

Returns:

output of Kappa GCN network

Return type:

logits_agg

get_logits(X, W=None, b=None)

Computes logits given the manifold.

Credit to the Curve Your Attention paper for an implementation we referenced: https://openreview.net/forum?id=AN5uo4ByWH

Parameters:

  • X (Float[Tensor, 'n_nodes dim']) – Input points tensor of shape (n, d), where n is the number of points and d is the dimensionality.

  • W (Optional[Float[Tensor, 'dims n_classes']]) – Weight tensor of shape (d, k), where k is the number of classes.

  • b (Optional[Float[Tensor, 'n_classes']]) – Bias tensor of shape (k,)

Returns:

tensor of shape (n, k).

Return type:

Logits

predict(X, A=None)

Make predictions using the trained Kappa GCN.

Parameters:

  • X (torch.Tensor) – Feature matrix (NxD).

  • A (torch.Tensor) – Adjacency or distance matrix (NxN).

Returns:

Predicted labels or outputs.

Return type:

torch.Tensor

Implementation for the Kappa GCN layer

Parameters:

  • out_features (Number of output features)

  • manifold (Manifold object for the Kappa GCN)

  • nonlinearity (Function for nonlinear activation.)

forward(X, A_hat=None)

Forward pass for the Kappa GCN layer.

Parameters:

  • X (Float[Tensor, 'n_nodes dim']) – Embedding matrix

  • A_hat (Optional[Float[Tensor, 'n_nodes n_nodes']]) – Normalized adjacency matrix

Returns:

Transformed node features after message passing and nonlinear activation.

Return type:

AXW

manify.predictors.kappa_gcn.get_A_hat(A, make_symmetric=True, add_self_loops=True)

Normalize adjacency matrix.

Parameters:

  • A (torch.Tensor) – Adjacency matrix.

  • make_symmetric (bool) – Whether to make the adjacency matrix symmetric.

  • add_self_loops (bool) – Whether to add self-loops to the adjacency matrix.

Returns:

Normalized adjacency matrix.

Return type:

torch.Tensor
